pull.title: rpc, wallet: use the same `next_index` key in `listdescriptors` and `importdescriptors`
pull.body:
Currently `listdescriptors` RPC uses `next` key to represent `WalletDescriptor::next_index` while `importdescriptors` uses `next_index`. This creates two different descriptor formats.

This  PR changes `listdescriptors` to use the same key as `importdescriptors`.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
As it's an API change, probably should add it to the release-notes.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26194/commits/b9ea106f1da4e018ec4876d8e5b1209401ace382 adds the `next_index` instead of replacing `next` as suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26194#discussion_r985017682 for compatibility reasons and adds the release notes as suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26194#issuecomment-1261301309.

events.message: rpc, wallet: use the same `next_index` in listdescriptors and importdescriptors

comments.body: There should be some compatibility at least for a release or two.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1772,6 +1772,7 @@ RPCHelpMan listdescriptors()
                         {RPCResult::Type::NUM, "", "Range end inclusive"},
                     }},
                     {RPCResult::Type::NUM, "next", /*optional=*/true, "The next index to generate addresses from; defined only for ranged descriptors"},
comments.body: If this is kept for compatibility, it might be good to mention it, and that the value is equal to the other. Otherwise users might be confused to see the same field twice and wonder what the difference is?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1772,6 +1772,7 @@ RPCHelpMan listdescriptors()
                         {RPCResult::Type::NUM, "", "Range end inclusive"},
                     }},
